00_pointsdata_to_spatial>00_pointsdata_t.description: Numerical value for the EPSG code (European Petroleum Survey Group) associated with the spatial reference system (projection and geodetic datum) to be used for data in the study area. For further information on coordinate systems and EPSG codes visit https://epsg.org/home.html.
00_pointsdata_to_spatial>00_pointsdata_t.label: espg_coords

00_auk_filter>auk_filter.yml@25|ebd_file.description: eBird Basic Dataset (EBD). This is a tab-separated text file, released monthly, containing all validated raw eBird observations and associated metadata at the time of release. Each row corresponds to the sightings of a single species within a checklist and in addition contains information about the individuals observed and the conditions under which the checklist was constructed. For more information, visit: https://science.ebird.org/en/use-ebird-data/download-ebird-data-products
00_auk_filter>auk_filter.yml@25|ebd_file.label: ebd_file

00_auk_filter>auk_filter.yml@25|ebd_samp.description: Sampling Event Data (SED). This is a tab-separated text file, released monthly, containing checklist data, but it includes only the effort data, not the associated bird data. Each row corresponds to a checklist. This file is required to zero-fill the data and therefor to run occupancy models. For more information, visit: https://science.ebird.org/en/use-ebird-data/download-ebird-data-products
00_auk_filter>auk_filter.yml@25|ebd_samp.label: ebd_sampling_file

00_auk_filter>auk_filter.yml@25|species.description: Scientific name of the species of interest for occupancy models. Scientific name correspond to the eBird taxonomy which is updated annually. For more information, visit: https://science.ebird.org/es-419/use-ebird-data/the-ebird-taxonomy
00_auk_filter>auk_filter.yml@25|species.label: species

00_studyarea_to_grid>studyarea_to_grid.y.description: Text string with the complete path location for the spatial file containing the study area boundaries. Accepted file types include shapefile (.shp), raster (.tif/GeoTIFF), GeoJSON (.json) or  GeoPackage (.gpkg).
00_studyarea_to_grid>studyarea_to_grid.y.label: Area de estudio

00_studyarea_to_grid>studyarea_to_grid.y.description: Numerical value for the EPSG code (European Petroleum Survey Group) associated with the spatial reference system (projection and geodetic datum) to be used for data in the study area. For further information on coordinate systems and EPSG codes visit https://epsg.org/home.html.
00_studyarea_to_grid>studyarea_to_grid.y.label: studyarea_epsg

00_studyarea_to_grid>studyarea_to_grid.y.description: Numerical value referring to the spatial resolution (pixel size) in square meters to create a grid of the study area. This value indicates the level of detail or granularity at which the study area will be analyzed. Each pixel will be considered as a study site for occupancy analyses.
00_studyarea_to_grid>studyarea_to_grid.y.label: studyarea_resolution

00_studyarea_covs>studyarea_covs.yml@27|.description: method of aggregation for the temperature data
00_studyarea_covs>studyarea_covs.yml@27|.label: zonal

00_eBird_format>eBird_format.yml@28|min_.description: Minimum number of observations required for each site.
00_eBird_format>eBird_format.yml@28|min_.label: min_obs

00_eBird_format>eBird_format.yml@28|max_.description: Maximum number of observations allowed for each site.
00_eBird_format>eBird_format.yml@28|max_.label: max_obs

00_eBird_format>eBird_format.yml@28|annu.description: Whether the entire year should be treated as the period of closure (the default). This can be useful, for example, if the data have been subset to a period of closure prior to calling
00_eBird_format>eBird_format.yml@28|annu.label: annual_closure

00_eBird_format>eBird_format.yml@28|n_da.description: Number of days defining the temporal length of closure. If annual_closure = TRUE closure periods will be split at year boundaries. If annual_closure = FALSE the closure periods will ignore year boundaries.
00_eBird_format>eBird_format.yml@28|n_da.label: n_days

00_eBird_format>eBird_format.yml@28|site.description: Names of one of more columns in x that define a site, typically the location (e.g. latitude/longitude) and observer ID.
00_eBird_format>eBird_format.yml@28|site.label: site_vars

00_eBird_format>eBird_format.yml@28|site.description: the variables that will act as site-level covariates, i.e. covariates that vary at the site level, for example, latitude/longitude or habitat predictors. If this parameter is missing, it will be assumed that any variable that is not an observation-level covariate (obs_covs) or the site_id, is a site-level covariate.
00_eBird_format>eBird_format.yml@28|site.label: site_covs

00_eBird_format>eBird_format.yml@28|obs_.description: The variables that will act as observation-level covariates, i.e. covariates that vary within sites, at the level of observations, for example, time or length of observation.
00_eBird_format>eBird_format.yml@28|obs_.label: obs_covs

00_occ_model_results>00_occ_model_result.description: Specifies that a histogram of the bootstrapped test statistic is to be included in the output. For dynamic occupancy models, this produces a histogram of the sum of the season-specific chi-squares for each bootstrap sample.
00_occ_model_results>00_occ_model_result.label: plot.hist

00_occ_model_results>00_occ_model_result.description: Result of Essential biodiversity variable in terms of Occupancy area VEB (Î¨>0.6)
00_occ_model_results>00_occ_model_result.label: FVEB
